title: Authors and Citation
Authors and Citation
text: Pastukhov (2024). ggradar: Collections Geoms Radar Plots. R package version 0.1.0, https://alexander-pastukhov.github.io/ggradar/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {ggradar: Collections of Geoms for Radar Plots},   author = {Alexander Pastukhov},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://alexander-pastukhov.github.io/ggradar/}, }

what: Collections of Geoms for Radar Plots
title: Collections of Geoms for Radar Plots
text: Collections geoms compatible ggplot2 polar coordinates. Includes point, line, ribbon, area geoms.

title: Collections of Geoms for Radar Plots
code: library("devtools") install_github("alexander-pastukhov/ggradat", dependencies=TRUE) example_df <- data.frame(x = factor(1:8),                          y = c(0.8, 0.4, 1.0, 0.6, 0.4, 0.3, 0.9, 0.2)) |>   mutate(ymin = y - runif(n(), 0, 0.2),          ymax = y + runif(n(), 0, 0.2))  ggplot2::ggplot(example_df, ggplot2::aes(x = x, y = y)) +   geom_radar_ribbon(aes(ymin = ymin, ymax = ymax), fill = "#b3dee5ff", alpha = 0.5) +   geom_radar_line(color = "#faac22ff") +   geom_radar_point(color = "#faac22ff", size = 5) +   ggplot2::coord_polar() +   ggplot2::ylim(0, 1.2) +   scale_x_discrete(name = NULL, labels = NULL) +   scale_y_continuous(name = NULL, labels = NULL)

what: Radar area for polar plot — geom_radar_area
title: Radar area for polar plot — geom_radar_area
text: Draws closed area. continuous scale ensures first last points share angular position.

title: Radar area for polar plot — geom_radar_area
code: geom_radar_area(   mapping = NULL,   data = NULL,   stat = "identity",   position = "identity",   ...,   show.legend = NA,   inherit.aes = TRUE )

title: Radar area for polar plot — geom_radar_area
text: mapping Set aesthetic mappings created aes(). specified inherit.aes = TRUE (default), combined default mapping top level plot. must supply mapping plot mapping. data data displayed layer. stat statistical transformation use data layer. position position adjustment use data layer. ... arguments passed layer()'s params argument. show.legend logical. layer included legends? inherit.aes FALSE, overrides default aesthetics, rather combining .

title: Radar area for polar plot — geom_radar_area
code: example_df <- data.frame(x = factor(c("One", "Two", "Three")),                          y = c(0.2, 0.4, 1.0)) ggplot2::ggplot(example_df, ggplot2::aes(x = x, y = y)) +   geom_radar_area() +   ggplot2::coord_polar() +   ggplot2::ylim(0, 1) #> Warning: Using the `size` aesthetic in this geom was deprecated in ggplot2 3.4.0. #> ℹ Please use `linewidth` in the `default_aes` field and elsewhere instead.

title: Radar line for polar plot — geom_radar_line
text: mapping Set aesthetic mappings created aes(). specified inherit.aes = TRUE (default), combined default mapping top level plot. must supply mapping plot mapping. data data displayed layer. stat statistical transformation use data layer. position position adjustment use data layer. ... arguments passed layer()'s params argument. show.legend logical. layer included legends? inherit.aes FALSE, overrides default aesthetics, rather combining .

title: Radar line for polar plot — geom_radar_line
code: example_df <- data.frame(x = factor(c("One", "Two", "Three")),                          y = c(0.2, 0.4, 1.0)) ggplot2::ggplot(example_df, ggplot2::aes(x = x, y = y)) +   geom_radar_line() +   ggplot2::coord_polar() +   ggplot2::ylim(0, 1)

what: Radar points for polar plot — geom_radar_point
title: Radar points for polar plot — geom_radar_point
text: continuous scale ensures first last points share angular position. discrete scale equivalent geom_point.

title: Radar points for polar plot — geom_radar_point
code: geom_radar_point(   mapping = NULL,   data = NULL,   stat = "identity",   position = "identity",   ...,   show.legend = NA,   inherit.aes = TRUE )

title: Radar points for polar plot — geom_radar_point
text: mapping Set aesthetic mappings created aes(). specified inherit.aes = TRUE (default), combined default mapping top level plot. must supply mapping plot mapping. data data displayed layer. stat statistical transformation use data layer. position position adjustment use data layer. ... arguments passed layer()'s params argument. show.legend logical. layer included legends? inherit.aes FALSE, overrides default aesthetics, rather combining .

title: Radar points for polar plot — geom_radar_point
code: example_df <- data.frame(x = factor(c("One", "Two", "Three")),                          y = c(0.2, 0.4, 1.0)) ggplot2::ggplot(example_df, ggplot2::aes(x = x, y = y)) +   geom_radar_point() +   ggplot2::coord_polar() +   ggplot2::ylim(0, 1)

code: geom_radar_ribbon(   mapping = NULL,   data = NULL,   stat = "identity",   position = "identity",   ...,   show.legend = NA,   inherit.aes = TRUE )

title: Radar ribbon for polar plot — geom_radar_ribbon
text: mapping Set aesthetic mappings created aes(). specified inherit.aes = TRUE (default), combined default mapping top level plot. must supply mapping plot mapping. data data displayed layer. stat statistical transformation use data layer. position position adjustment use data layer. ... arguments passed layer()'s params argument. show.legend logical. layer included legends? inherit.aes FALSE, overrides default aesthetics, rather combining .

title: Radar ribbon for polar plot — geom_radar_ribbon
code: example_df <- data.frame(x = factor(c("One", "Two", "Three")),                          y = c(0.15, 0.3, 0.75),                          ymin = c(0.1, 0.2, 0.5),                          ymax = c(0.2, 0.4, 1.0)) ggplot2::ggplot(example_df, ggplot2::aes(x = x, y = y, ymin = ymin, ymax = ymax)) +   geom_radar_ribbon() +   ggplot2::coord_polar() +   ggplot2::ylim(0, 1)
